title: 4 Easy Ways to Get Subtitles and Captions on Netflix

steps.title: Open the Netflix app.
steps.content: Open the Netflix app. There are many ways to watch Netflix on TV . You can use a Smart TV, Chromecast, Roku, Amazon Fire Stick, PlayStation, and Xbox. You can use multiple devices at once by changing your Netflix plan . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select a movie or TV show.
steps.content: Select a movie or TV show. You'll need to have a video active to toggle its subtitles.

steps.title: Click the movie to begin playing.
steps.content: Click the movie to begin playing. You can pause the video or allow it to play in the background.

steps.title: Using your remote, press up or down.
steps.content: Using your remote, press up or down. You'll see a toolbar with playback buttons and settings.

steps.title: Click Audio & Subtitles.
steps.content: Click Audio & Subtitles . This will look like a text box icon, located to the left of Playback Speed . This will bring up a pop-up window. Depending on your device, this menu can be on the top or bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Select your subtitles.
steps.content: Select your subtitles. In most cases, you'll be able to find English . If a TV show or movie supports a different language, you'll find them here. To turn subtitles off, click Off .

steps.content: Open the Netflix app. This will have the red Netflix logo with a black background. The Netflix app is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store. [2] X Research source

steps.content: Open Netflix in your browser. Netflix is supported by Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Mozilla Firefox, Opera, and Safari for Mac. [4] X Research source You'll need to register for Netflix to stream content.

steps.content: Click the "Audio" and "Subtitle" settings. This will look like a text box icon, located to the left of Playback Speed . This will bring up a pop-up window. steps.content: Swipe down on the Apple TV remote. This will bring up a pop-up window with your settings. For Apple TV 2 or Apple TV 3, hold down the center button of the remote.

steps.content: Navigate to the Subtitles tab. You will also see Info and Audio .
